abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the La Paz Municipal
            Development Project for Bolivia were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, project sustainability was uncertain,
            Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance
            was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: clear
            and quantifiable project objectives and goals, as well as
            separate cost accounting, must be established from the
            beginning to allow proper project implementation e x-post
            evaluation. Technological changes intended to improve
            financial management system must be designed in accordance
            with the existing culture, need managerial commitment and
            political support, and should provide for continuous
            training. Private sector participation should always be
            considered as an alternative to managing most public
            functions within a municipality. Effective design and
            management of a centralized implementation unit is a key
            success factor in projects comprising activities related to
            numerous agencies.
